```ruby
require "google/cloud/firestore"
require "google/cloud/secret_manager"

@firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new project_id: ENV['GCP_PROJECT']
secret_manager = Google::Cloud::SecretManager.secret_manager_service

```
Having the firestore line by itself doesnt seem to trigger it, adding the SecretManager line does.

issue.title: [Ruby] add aarch64 linux build

labels.name: release notes: no
labels.description: Indicates if PR should not be in release notes

labels.name: imported
labels.description: Specifies if the PR has been imported to the internal repository

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

issue.body:
This adds pre-built library for aarch64 linux, will help improve the install speed and avoid building environment issues at customer side.

@apolcyn @jtattermusch Can you help build and push the new rake compiler image?
Will update the tag and hash after the image is available

Manually tested locally:
```
uname -a
Linux u20 5.15.49-linuxkit #1 SMP PREEMPT Tue Sep 13 07:51:32 UTC 2022 aarch64 aarch64 aarch64 GNU/Linux
```
```
time gem install /work/ruby/grpc/pkg/grpc-1.56.0.dev-aarch64-linux.gem
Successfully installed grpc-1.56.0.dev-aarch64-linux
Parsing documentation for grpc-1.56.0.dev-aarch64-linux
Installing ri documentation for grpc-1.56.0.dev-aarch64-linux
Done installing documentation for grpc after 0 seconds
1 gem installed

real	0m22.794s
user	0m17.268s
sys	0m5.156s
```
```
ruby greeter_server.rb &
[1] 319
ruby greeter_client.rb
"Greeting: Hello world"
```

Fixes: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/31855
Fixes: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/29489
Fixes: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/26391

body:
Which alpine version are you using? Is it possible to provide you dockerfile?
I'm testing with latest alpine but it failed immediately with the greeter example, with both 1.57.0 and 1.56.2.
I'm getting a similar segmentation fault on 1.57.0 / macos / python 3.9. Reverting to 1.56.2 fixes this for me.

> Which alpine version are you using? Is it possible to provide you dockerfile? I'm testing with latest alpine but it failed immediately with the greeter example, with both 1.57.0 and 1.56.2.

It is the ruby:3.1-alpine image

Dockerfile:
```
FROM ruby:3.1-alpine

RUN apk update &&  \
    apk add --no-cache build-base gcompat

WORKDIR /usr/src/app

COPY Gemfile ./
RUN bundle install
COPY test_defect_34044.rb ./
CMD ["bundle","exec", "ruby", "test_defect_34044.rb"]
```

I run this with a bind mount of my GCP creds JSON file mounted as /tmp/keys/gcp_project_creds.json
And then environment variables of:
GCP_PROJECT=xxxxxxx
GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS=/tmp/keys/gcp_project_creds.json
GRPC_TRACE=api,call_error
GRPC_VERBOSITY=DEBUG

issue.title: [Ruby] replace strdup with gpr_strdup

labels.name: release notes: yes
labels.description: Indicates if PR needs to be in release notes

labels.name: imported
labels.description: Specifies if the PR has been imported to the internal repository

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

issue.body:
grpc 1.57.0 crashes win ruby and alpine due to no `strdup` in musl libc.
This diff replace `strdup` with `grp_strdup`

```
Thread 1 "ruby" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00000000000a4596 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00000000000a4596 in ?? ()
#1  0x00007ffff14e298c in grpc_rb_channel_create_in_process_add_args_hash_cb (key=<optimized out>, val=<optimized out>, args_obj=<optimized out>) at rb_channel_args.c:84
#2  0x00007ffff7c2b9ea in hash_ar_foreach_iter (error=0, argp=140737488344784, value=<optimized out>, key=<optimized out>) at hash.c:1341
```

fixes #34044
closes #27995

body:
@womblep 
This is due to no `strdup` in musl libc
Fix is in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/34177
You can set `LD_PRELOAD=/lib/libgcompat.so.0` as a workaround before the fix.

issue.title: Ruby Segfault observed since 1.58.0

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

issue.body:
<!--
PLEASE DO NOT POST A QUESTION HERE.

For general questions and troubleshooting, please ask/look for answers at StackOverflow, with "grpc" tag: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/grpc

For questions that specifically need to be answered by gRPC team members, please ask/look for answers at grpc.io mailing list: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/grpc-io

Issues specific to *grpc-java*, *grpc-go*, *grpc-node*, *grpc-dart*, *grpc-web* should be created in the repository they belong to (e.g. https://github.com/grpc/grpc-LANGUAGE/issues/new)
-->

### What version of gRPC and what language are you using?
**Language**: Ruby  
**gRPC versions affected**: All versions from 1.58.0 through 1.73.0 (latest)  
**Last working version**: 1.57.0

### What operating system (Linux, Windows,...) and version?
**Operating System**: Alpine Linux 3.16 (musl libc)  
**Architecture**: aarch64 (ARM64)  
**Container**: Docker with Alpine Linux base image

### What runtime / compiler are you using (e.g. python version or version of gcc)
**Ruby**: 3.0.6p216 (2023-03-30 revision 23a532679b) [aarch64-linux-musl]  
**musl libc**: Alpine Linux default

### What did you do?
We encountered this segfault while using **Google Cloud Pub/Sub** Ruby client library on Alpine Linux. (https://cloud.google.com/ruby/docs/reference/google-cloud-pubsub/latest/index.html) 

The issue occurs when the Pub/Sub client makes gRPC calls that trigger channel creation with musl libc.

We have created a **minimal reproducible example** that demonstrates this segfault consistently. The repository with full reproduction steps and automated testing is available at: https://github.com/jdcalvin/ruby_grpc_segfault_debug



### What did you expect to see?
Expected the gRPC call to either succeed or throw a proper Ruby exception (like `Google::Cloud::UnavailableError`), not crash with a segmentation fault.

### What did you see instead?
Huge segfault log starts with:
```
/usr/local/bundle/gems/grpc-1.63.2-aarch64-linux/src/ruby/lib/grpc/generic/active_call.rb:374: [BUG] Segmentation fault at 0x00000000000ab250
ruby 3.0.6p216 (2023-03-30 revision 23a532679b) [aarch64-linux-musl]

-- Control frame information -----------------------------------------------
c:0012 p:---- s:0082 e:000081 CFUNC  :run_batch
c:0011 p:0088 s:0077 e:000076 METHOD /usr/local/bundle/gems/grpc-1.63.2-aarch64-linux/src/ruby/lib/grpc/generic/active_call.rb:374
c:0010 p:0012 s:0068 e:000067 BLOCK  /usr/local/bundle/gems/grpc-1.63.2-aarch64-linux/src/ruby/lib/grpc/generic/client_stub.rb:174
c:0009 p:0013 s:0065 e:000064 METHOD /usr/local/bundle/gems/grpc-1.63.2-aarch64-linux/src/ruby/lib/grpc/generic/interceptors.rb:170
c:0008 p:0010 s:0058 e:000057 BLOCK  /usr/local/bundle/gems/grpc-1.63.2-aarch64-linux/src/ruby/lib/grpc/generic/client_stub.rb:173 [FINISH]
c:0007 p:0064 s:0055 e:000054 METHOD /usr/local/bundle/gems/gapic-common-0.21.1/lib/gapic/grpc/service_stub/rpc_call.rb:123
c:0006 p:0039 s:0042 e:000041 METHOD /usr/local/bundle/gems/gapic-common-0.21.1/lib/gapic/grpc/service_stub.rb:205
c:0005 p:0344 s:0032 e:000031 METHOD /usr/local/bundle/gems/google-iam-v1-1.1.0/lib/google/iam/v1/iam_policy/client.rb:372
c:0004 p:0016 s:0022 e:000021 METHOD /usr/local/bundle/gems/google-cloud-pubsub-2.19.0/lib/google/cloud/pubsub/service.rb:412
c:0003 p:0012 s:0016 e:000015 METHOD /usr/local/bundle/gems/google-cloud-pubsub-2.19.0/lib/google/cloud/pubsub/topic.rb:896
c:0002 p:0195 s:0010 E:0007a0 EVAL   ./minimal_segfault_test.rb:32 [FINISH]
c:0001 p:0000 s:0003 E:002430 (none) [FINISH]
```

### Anything else we should know about your project / environment?
**Environment-specific behavior**: This segfault appears to be specific to **musl libc environments** (Alpine Linux). The same code works correctly in:

- **macOS** (local development environment)
- **Other Linux environments** (observed to work, but not exhaustively tested)
